body: @borisstoyanov a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests

Thanks @romain-dartigues for your PR, I've included similar changes in PR #2211 and added pylint/pep checks to Travis. Due to duplicate nature of work and that this PR has not received much activity in last 1+ year I'll close this. Many thanks again for your hard work and initiative.

Thanks @PaulAngus and @DagSonsteboSB for the initial work, I've used the concepts to polish the implementation in #2211 and we're able to show that patching is do-able without needing reboot. With that I'll close this PR since it's not maintained and rest of work has already continued in #2211. Again, many thanks for the effort.
@syed ping?
Closed this PR as this was experimental work between Abhi, and colleagues. This is not maintained, worked upon anymore.

Hey, I reported the keyboard problem earlier as well. If you do a right click -> reload frame it will start taking your keyboard strokes. I never got the fix though. Let me  know if you need any help from me.

Code LGTM. Thanks for the PR, @rhtyd.
LGTM, merging. All errors seen are intermittent and env related.
@rafaelweingartner please add a JIRA id for this, thanks.
LGTM, simple NPE check.
Given our current regression testing system does not have GPU capabilties, I'll use travis test results as verification of the build/code, two reviews/lgtms and merge this PR.
Tests LGTM, the failures are known intermittent issues and not caused by this PR.
@sachinnitw1317 the expectation is that once you've the novnc console/UI you should be able to click on ti and start typing. Anyway to fix that?
Ping - can we have +1/-1 on code review?
Thanks @GabrielBrascher for the review. However, perhaps another way to solve the issue is to fix `host_view`.

@rhtyd if this helps for anything, I have this solution running in production for over a month now.
Let's see what other have to say now
Merged based on prod test recommendation and regression test results.

Code LGTM.
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Good cleanup, we'll need some extended testing on this one.
@DaanHoogland please rebase and fix conflicts
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
@svenvogel we need to hear from @fmaximus on the failures seen in the test results -- if they are caused by this change or intermittent/env introduced
@pavanaravapalli  please rebase and fix conflicts
@GabrielBrascher ping, update on this PR? (looks like build failure)

@swill thanks for the PR, I've ported the commit from your PR to #2211 where I'm able to repeatedly get the tests pass on KVM and XenServer now! Given there is no activity/response on this PR, I'll close this PR and get your stuff tested and merged via #2211 now. Again, many thanks for the work.
@rhtyd I will check on that.
LGTM. @WingkaiHo can you add a JIRA ID for this?
@rhtyd done.
@borisstoyanov good find, under what params/API cases this happens and it's not failing for KVM/XS?
@wenwenxiong any update?
Thanks @pfarmer for the pull request, given it's not applicable to master/4.11 anymore I'll close this. Kindly re-submit a new PR. Thanks again for your contribution.
@alexandrelimassantana can you rebase and fix conflicts?
@milamberspace can you rebase and fix conflicts?
LGTM, are we okay to merge this ?
LGTM based on regression tests, is this ready for merging?
Packaging result: ✖centos6 ✖centos7 ✖debian. JID-1364
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1363
@jayapalu can you fix conflicts and move sql related changes to appropriate 4.10->4.11 path?
@anshul1886 is this still relevant, if so please fix conflicts and rebase against latest master?

Thanks @jayakarteek for the pull request, this is not relevant to master anymore where we've moved to embedded Jetty now. Closing this PR on this remark, you may re-submit a different PR against master for embedded-jetty.

@rhtyd Alexandre is not working in ACS anymore. So, I took over this PR.
The bug fix is at line 2451; however, @alexandrelimassantana took the liberty to break down some bigger methods into smaller ones.
Thank you @rhtyd!  Sorry I am have been so MIA on this.  I really appreciate the effort to get the test cases working correctly.
@blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
It was VMware, I remember just listing the volume leads to this NPE, no specifics needed to the api call @rhtyd
Close. Replace by #2358
Thanks @borisstoyanov I found a potential NPE causing code and fixed in #2211
LGTM. This is a simple change in default config, I'll merge as soon as Travis is green.
Maybe it's a good idea to address each issue in a separate PR, just in case #2211 drops out of 4.11, thoughts @rhtyd ?

@borisstoyanov I disagree, #2211 already should qualify for merging -- we've all smoke tests passing on KVM, all smoke (except for one vpc_redundant test case) tests passing on XenServer. Given lab related IO issues, we've some failing tests on VMware, compared to master most tests are still passing on #2211 and we've about a month to freeze date.
@rhtyd I downloaded the vmware jars and fixed the compilation error

Thanks @marcaurele
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

@DaanHoogland a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@rhtyd @borisstoyanov master rebased, Jenkins and Travis are green now
LGTM merging, the one job has been kicked again that failed due to timeout issues.

Additional review from others request.

I'll introduce `net-tools` as a dependency for centos7/cloudstack-agent, as there may be other commands/places where router/ifconfig maybe in use.
Thanks @lmrv I've ported your patch to #2211 for inclusion crediting the commit to your name/email. I'll close this PR now.

@rhtyd I haven't actually examined the code for this PR. I was serving mainly as a source of answers for questions regarding how this feature might interact with managed storage. Let me know if we still need reviewers. At the time being, I've been racing pretty hard to finish up another project, so I probably couldn't spend the necessary time until, say, mid next week.
how to add patch to jira
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

@WingkaiHo go to https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa, create an account if necessary and submit a ticket under CLOUDSTACK project. And share here the JIRA-ID (or ticket ID, something like `CLOUDSTACK-xxxxx`)
